channel.title: How do i host?
channel.description:
ok. So my port is setup and is open, i have a no-ip, im using a linksys WRT54Gv2, i have my own 317 source, but i dont know why i cant host. Yes i am running the server with run.bat...
I can connect only on my computer but anyone else who logs in with my no-ip cant. It says error or no response from server.
Any thoughts or questions that might be able to help would be appreciated.

item.title: How do i host?
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

You might not need this but,

Go to www.utorrent.com
Download UTorrent.

Open it
Go to file? I think it is

Click preferences
Click connection

Set the port as 43594.

I heard you can’t do this anymore, so to do it you have to download an older version of uTorrent.

Good Luck.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i host?
item.dc:creator: @sng sng
item.description:
@sng wrote:

First off, you downloaded No - IP, right? Second, open it up, and click the check. That should be it for No-IP.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i host?
item.dc:creator: @Global_Fear Global Fear
item.description:
@Global_Fear wrote:

Thanks. Im not home atm but i did check on portforward.com port forward checker. The one that needs to be downloaded and it says my port is open.

Mind explaining how my no-ip may be wrong? Some things i should check?..

Read full topic

item.title: How do i host?
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

go to www.canyouseeme.org and check if you can see your port there. If you can, then you should be able to get players. If you can’t, you probably have no-ip set up wrong, or it isn’t running. It will be in your taskbar if it is successfully running.

Read full topic
